DataElement.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Iobenguane Sulfate I-123 Technique Performed Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of date that diagnostic imaging I-123 MIBG was performed on patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diagnostic Imaging Iobenguane Sulfate I-123 Imaging Technique Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._The neurotransmitter analogue 3-nitrobenzylguanidine conjugated to iodine I 123 and used as a gamma-emitting imaging agent. The adrenergic tissue uptake and storage of I-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine (I-123 MIBG) mimics that of norepinephrine (NE). The distribution of this agent enables the scintigraphic imaging of neural crest tumors, such as neuroblastoma and pheochromocytoma._Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredName: Iobenguane Sulfate I-123 Imaging Technique Performed
Property.preferredDefinition: The neurotransmitter analogue 3-nitrobenzylguanidine conjugated to iodine I 123 and used as a gamma-emitting imaging agent. The adrenergic tissue uptake and storage of I-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine (I-123 MIBG) mimics that of norepinephrine (NE). The distribution of this agent enables the scintigraphic imaging of neural crest tumors, such as neuroblastoma and pheochromocytoma.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Executed and carried through to completion.

Concepts.definition: The neurotransmitter analogue 3-nitrobenzylguanidine conjugated to iodine I 123 and used as a gamma-emitting imaging agent. The adrenergic tissue uptake and storage of I-123 metaiodobenzylguanidine (I-123 MIBG) mimics that of norepinephrine (NE). The distribution of this agent enables the scintigraphic imaging of neural crest tumors, such as neuroblastoma and pheochromocytoma.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A particular date on which an imaging study is conducted.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
